title: Update contact email and re-enable device SMS deep link alongside WhatsApp and tel actions

requirements.text: Replace the contact/credits email address `arinfotech@gmail.com` with `arinfotech1993@gmail.com` everywhere it is displayed or referenced in the frontend UI and repository documentation.

quotes: change the mail arinfotech@gmail.com to arinfotech1993@gmail.com

acceptanceCriteria: Searching the repo for `arinfotech@gmail.com` returns zero matches.
Searching the repo for `arinfotech1993@gmail.com` returns at least one match in the intended contact/credits location(s).
All user-facing text remains in English.

requirements.text: Update the Dashboard "Officer Messaging" card to support sending the composed alert text via the current device’s SMS application using an `sms:` deep link, while preserving the existing WhatsApp Web action and tel: calling action.

quotes: so that sms and call from this device work smoothly. the sms send througn the web whatapp as well as from this device by mobile link

acceptanceCriteria: When an officer is selected on the Dashboard, the messaging card shows an action that initiates an `sms:` deep link using the selected officer’s mobile number and the composed message body.
If the SMS deep link cannot be initiated or fails, the UI shows an inline actionable error state and provides a one-click way to copy the message text (clipboard).
The WhatsApp action continues to open a WhatsApp chat for the selected officer with the message prefilled.
The tel: action continues to initiate a phone call from the current device/browser (no implication of Arduino/GSM-module calling).

requirements.text: Add a "Send SMS from This Device" action to the Officers Directory list actions for each officer row using an `sms:` deep link; include a graceful fallback to copying the message payload if the deep link cannot be opened.

quotes: the sms send througn the web whatapp as well as from this device by mobile link

acceptanceCriteria: Each officer row in the Officers list includes an action to initiate an `sms:` deep link to that officer’s mobile number.
If the SMS deep link cannot be initiated or fails, the UI provides a clear English error message and a one-click copy-to-clipboard option for the SMS text.
Existing WhatsApp Chat / WhatsApp Call handoff / Call from This Device / Copy Number actions continue to work.

requirements.text: Ensure user-facing help/labels clearly distinguish between (a) WhatsApp Web handoff, (b) SMS via the user’s current device SMS app (`sms:` link), and (c) calling via the user’s current device (`tel:` link), without implying the web app sends SMS through the Arduino GSM/GPRS module.

quotes: so that sms and call from this device work smoothly. the sms send througn the web whatapp as well as from this device by mobile link

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard and Officers screens contain clear English microcopy indicating SMS and calls are initiated from the user’s current device/browser via `sms:`/`tel:` links.
No UI copy implies that clicking web buttons will send SMS via the Arduino UNO GSM/GPRS module SIM.
WhatsApp labeling indicates it opens WhatsApp (Web/app) for the selected officer, depending on the environment and popup-blocker constraints.

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Backend remains single-actor Motoko architecture; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not add any third-party SMS gateway integration; only use deep links (`sms:`/`tel:`) and WhatsApp Web handoff.
nonGoals: Do not implement or claim true SMS delivery from the web app without user interaction (no background SMS sending).
Do not change Firebase RTDB schema or telemetry subscription behavior as part of this request.
Do not implement Arduino GSM-module SMS sending logic in the web app (Arduino-side SMS sending remains separate).
